org.cougaar.mts.base
Interface MessageDeliverer

All Superinterfaces:
Service
All Known Implementing Classes:
AgentFlowAspect.MessageDelivererDelegate, HeartBeatAspect.MessageDelivererDelegate, MessageDelivererDelegateImplBase, MessageDelivererImpl, MulticastAspect.MessageDelivererDelegate, TraceAspect.MessageDelivererDelegate, WatcherAspect.MessageDelivererDelegate
public interface MessageDeliverer
extends Service

The first or second station for an outgoing message on the receive side is a MessageDeliverer (first if no serialization, second otherwise).

In theory a given Message Transport subsystem can have multiple MessageDeliverers. For this release we only make one, instantiated as a MessageDelivererImpl. Either way, the MessageDeliverers are instantiated by a MessageDelivererFactory, accessible as the MTS-internal MessageDeliver service,

The deliverMessage method is used to pass the messages onto the next stop, a ReceiveLink. The LinkProtocol is responsible for calling the MessageDeliverer's deliverMessage after it reaches the destination node.

The previous station is MessageReader if the Java serialization was used or DestinationLink on the sender side otherwise. The next station is ReceiveLink.

See Also:
MessageDelivererFactory, SendLink, SendQueue, Router, DestinationQueue, DestinationLink, MessageWriter, MessageReader, Javadoc contributions from George Mount.

Method Detail

deliverMessage

MessageAttributes deliverMessage(AttributedMessage message,
                                 MessageAddress dest)
                                 throws MisdeliveredMessageException
Called by the LinkProtocol on the receiving side. Chooses the correct ReceiveLink associated with the target address and calls the deliverMessage.

Parameters:
message - The mesage to be delivered.
dest - The target MessageTransportClient address.
Throws:
MisdeliveredMessageException
See Also:
LinkProtocol, ReceiveLink.deliverMessage(AttributedMessage)

matches

boolean matches(java.lang.String name)
Returns true iff this MessageDeliverer is associated with the given name. Currently there is only one MessageDeliverer per node. Used by MessageDelivererFactory should there be multiple MessageDeliverers.

Parameters:
name - The MessageDeliverer name to compare against the one associated with this MessageDeliverer
